title: Calories in 1 Tbsp Sugar
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 tbsp sugar, including carbs, sugars, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with quick tweaks and FAQs for better understanding.
assumptions: Granulated white sugar; 1 tbsp ≈12.5 g; leveled, not heaping.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by sugar type, brand, packing density, and measurement; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1 tbsp granulated sugar contains ~48 kcal, all from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use powdered sugar (less dense, per tbsp)

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 tbsp sugar?
faqs.a: Approximately 48 kcal for granulated white sugar.
Yes, 1 tbsp sugar is nearly 100% carbs (12.5 g), all simple sugars.

faqs.q: Does brown sugar have more calories than white?
faqs.a: Slightly—about 50 kcal per tbsp due to added molasses.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in 1 tbsp?
faqs.a: Around 12.5 g of sugars, providing quick energy but no fiber or protein.

faqs.q: Can I reduce calories in recipes using sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, swap for lower-calorie alternatives like stevia or reduce amount by 25-50% in baking.
